x-module-descriptions.Internal: Internal methods for SDK / FEE integration
x-module-descriptions.Accessibility:
The `Accessibility` module provides access to the user/device settings for closed captioning and voice guidance.

Apps **SHOULD** attempt o respect these settings, rather than manage and persist seprate settings, which would be different per-app.
x-module-descriptions.Account: A module for querying about the device account.
x-module-descriptions.AcknowledgeChallenge: A module for registering as a provider for a user grant in which the user confirms access to a capability
x-module-descriptions.Activatable: Methods and events for responding to lifecycle changes in your app
x-module-descriptions.Advertising: A module for platform provided advertising settings and functionality.
x-module-descriptions.Application: Methods and events for responding to lifecycle changes in your app
x-module-descriptions.AudioDescriptions: A module for managing audio-description Settings.
x-module-descriptions.Authentication: A module for acquiring authentication tokens.
x-module-descriptions.Capabilities: The Capabilities module provides information about which discreet unit of functionality is enabled for the apps.
x-module-descriptions.ClosedCaptions: A module for managing closed-captions Settings.
x-module-descriptions.Device: A module for querying about the device and it's capabilities.
x-module-descriptions.Discovery:
Your App likely wants to integrate with the Platform's discovery capabilities. For example to add a "Watch Next" tile that links to your app from the platform's home screen.

Getting access to this information requires to connect to lower level APIs made available by the platform. Since implementations differ between operators and platforms, the Firebolt SDK offers a Discovery module, that exposes a generic, agnostic interface to the developer.

Under the hood, an underlaying transport layer will then take care of calling the right APIs for the actual platform implementation that your App is running on.

The Discovery plugin is used to _send_ information to the Platform.

### Localization
Apps should provide all user-facing strings in the device's language, as specified by the Firebolt `Localization.language` property.

Apps should provide prices in the same currency presented in the app. If multiple currencies are supported in the app, the app should provide prices in the user's current default currency.
x-module-descriptions.HDMIInput: Methods for managing HDMI inputs on an HDMI sink device.
x-module-descriptions.Keyboard: Methods for prompting users to enter text with task-oriented UX
x-module-descriptions.Lifecycle: Methods and events for responding to lifecycle changes in your app
x-module-descriptions.Localization: Methods for accessessing location and language preferences
x-module-descriptions.Parameters: Methods for getting initialization parameters for an app cold launch.
x-module-descriptions.PinChallenge: A module for registering as a provider for a user grant in which the user is prompted for a pin for access to a capability
x-module-descriptions.Privacy: A module for managing device settings.
x-module-descriptions.Profile: Methods for getting information about the current user/account profile
x-module-descriptions.SecondScreen: Methods for communicating with second screen devices
x-module-descriptions.SecureStorage: A module for storing and retrieving secure data owned by the app
x-module-descriptions.Sleepable: Methods and events for responding to lifecycle changes in your app
x-module-descriptions.UserGrants: A module for managing grants given by the user
x-module-descriptions.VoiceGuidance: A module for managing voice-guidance Settings.
x-module-descriptions.Wifi: A module for providing support for Wifi.

methods.name: Discovery.entityInfo
methods.summary: Provide information about a program entity and its available watchable assets, such as entitlement status and price, via either a push or pull call flow.
methods.description:
Provide information about a program entity and its available watchable assets, such as entitlement status and price, via either a push or pull call flow. Includes information about the program entity and its relevant associated entities, such as extras, previews, and, in the case of TV series, seasons and episodes.

See the `EntityInfo` and `WayToWatch` data structures below for more information.

The app only needs to implement Pull support for `entityInfo` at this time.

result.name: success
result.summary: True if the push operation is successful

methods.name: Discovery.purchasedContent
methods.summary: Provide a list of purchased content for the authenticated account, such as rentals and electronic sell through purchases.

result.name: success
result.summary: True if the push operation is successful

examples.name: Inform the platform of the user's purchased content

entries.title: Cool Runnings
entries.synopsis: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Pulvinar sapien et ligula ullamcorper malesuada proin libero nunc.

methods.description:
Return content purchased by the user, such as rentals and electronic sell through purchases.

The app should return the user's 100 most recent purchases in `entries`. The total count of purchases must be provided in `count`. If `count` is greater than the total number of `entries`, the UI may provide a link into the app to see the complete purchase list.

The `EntityInfo` object returned is not required to have `waysToWatch` populated, but it is recommended that it do so in case the UI wants to surface additional information on the purchases screen.

The app should implement both Push and Pull methods for `purchasedContent`.

The app should actively push `purchasedContent` when:

*  The app becomes Active.
*  When the state of the purchasedContent set has changed.
*  The app goes into Inactive or Background state, if there is a chance a change event has been missed.

methods.name: Discovery.entitlements
methods.summary: Inform the platform of the users latest entitlements w/in this app.

result.name: success
result.summary: whether the call was successful or not

methods.name: Discovery.contentAccess
methods.summary: Inform the platform of what content the user can access either by discovering it or consuming it. Availabilities determine which content is discoverable to a user, while entitlements determine if the user can currently consume that content. Content can be available but not entitled, this means that user can see the content but when they try to open it they must gain an entitlement either through purchase or subscription upgrade. In case the access changed off-device, this API should be called any time the app comes to the foreground to refresh the access. This API should also be called any time the availabilities or entitlements change within the app for any reason. Typical reasons may include the user signing into an account or upgrading a subscription. Less common cases can cause availabilities to change, such as moving to a new service location. When availabilities or entitlements are removed from the subscriber (such as when the user signs out), then an empty array should be given. To clear both, use the Discovery.clearContentAccess convenience API.

params.name: ids
params.summary: A list of identifiers that represent content that is discoverable or consumable for the subscriber

methods.name: Discovery.clearContentAccess
methods.summary: Clear both availabilities and entitlements from the subscriber. This is equivalent of calling `Discovery.contentAccess({ availabilities: [], entitlements: []})`. This is typically called when the user signs out of an account.

methods.name: Discovery.launch
methods.summary:
Launch or foreground the specified app, and optionally instructs it to navigate to the specified user action. 
 For the Primary Experience, the appId can be any one of:  

 - xrn:firebolt:application-type:main 

 - xrn:firebolt:application-type:settings

params.name: appId
params.summary: The durable app Id of the app to launch

params.name: intent
params.summary: An optional `NavigationIntent` with details about what part of the app to show first, and context around how/why it was launched

result.name: success
result.summary: whether the call was successful or not

examples.name: Launch the 'Foo' app to it's home screen.
Launch the 'Foo' app to it's own page for a specific entity.
Launch the 'Foo' app to a fullscreen playback experience for a specific entity.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to a global page for a specific entity.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to a global page for the company / partner with the ID 'foo'.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to it's home screen, as if the Home remote button was pressed.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to it's search screen.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to it's settings screen.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to it's linear/epg guide.
Launch the Aggregated Experience to the App Store details page for a specfic app with the ID 'foo'.

methods.name: Discovery.signIn
methods.summary: Inform the platform that your user is signed in, for increased visibility in search & discovery. Sign-in state is used separately from what content can be access through entitlements and availabilities. Sign-in state may be used when deciding whether to choose this app to handle a user intent. For instance, if the user tries to launch something generic like playing music from an artist, only a signed-in app will be chosen. If the user wants to tune to a channel, only a signed-in app will be chosen to handle that intent. While signIn can optionally include entitlements as those typically change at signIn time, it is recommended to make a separate call to Discovery.contentAccess for entitlements. signIn is not only for when a user explicitly enters login credentials. If an app does not require any credentials from the user to consume content, such as in a free app, then the app should call signIn immediately on launch.

params.name: entitlements
params.summary: Optional array of Entitlements, in case of a different user account, or a long time since last sign-in.

methods.name: Discovery.signOut
methods.summary: Inform the platform that your user has signed out. See `Discovery.signIn` for more details on how the sign-in state is used.signOut will NOT clear entitlements, the app should make a separate call to Discovery.clearContentAccess. Apps should also call signOut when a login token has expired and the user is now in a signed-out state.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaLoadStart
methods.summary: Called when setting the URL of a media asset to play, in order to infer load time.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaPlay
methods.summary: Called when media playback should start due to autoplay, user-initiated play, or unpausing.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaPlaying
methods.summary: Called when media playback actually starts due to autoplay, user-initiated play, unpausing, or recovering from a buffering interuption.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaPause
methods.summary: Called when media playback will pause due to an intentional pause operation.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaWaiting
methods.summary: Called when media playback will halt due to a network, buffer, or other unintentional constraint.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaProgress
methods.summary: Called every 60 seconds as media playback progresses.

params.name: progress
params.summary: Progress of playback, as a decimal percentage (0-0.999) for content with a known duration, or an integer number of seconds (0-86400) for content with an unknown duration.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaSeeking
methods.summary: Called when a seek is initiated during media playback.

params.name: target
params.summary: Target destination of the seek, as a decimal percentage (0-0.999) for content with a known duration, or an integer number of seconds (0-86400) for content with an unknown duration.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaSeeked
methods.summary: Called when a seek is completed during media playback.

params.name: position
params.summary: Resulting position of the seek operation, as a decimal percentage (0-0.999) for content with a known duration, or an integer number of seconds (0-86400) for content with an unknown duration.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaRateChange
methods.summary: Called when the playback rate of media is changed.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaRenditionChange
methods.summary: Called when the playback rendition (e.g. bitrate, dimensions, profile, etc) is changed.

params.name: profile
params.summary: A description of the new profile, e.g. 'HDR' etc.

methods.name: Metrics.mediaEnded
methods.summary: Called when playback has stopped because the end of the media was reached.

methods.name: Metrics.event
methods.summary: Inform the platform of 1st party distributor metrics.

params.name: schema
params.summary: The schema URI of the metric type

params.name: data
params.summary: A JSON payload conforming the the provided schema

methods.name: Parameters.initialization
methods.summary: Returns any initialization parameters for the app, e.g. initialial `NavigationIntent`.

methods.name: Discovery.onPullEntityInfo
methods.summary: Provide information about a program entity and its available watchable assets, such as entitlement status and price, via either a push or pull call flow.
methods.description:
Provide information about a program entity and its available watchable assets, such as entitlement status and price, via either a push or pull call flow. Includes information about the program entity and its relevant associated entities, such as extras, previews, and, in the case of TV series, seasons and episodes.

See the `EntityInfo` and `WayToWatch` data structures below for more information.

The app only needs to implement Pull support for `entityInfo` at this time.

examples.name: Send entity info for a movie to the platform.
Send entity info for a movie with a trailer to the platform.
Send entity info for a TV Series with seasons and episodes to the platform.

methods.name: Discovery.onPullPurchasedContent
methods.summary: Provide a list of purchased content for the authenticated account, such as rentals and electronic sell through purchases.

examples.name: Inform the platform of the user's purchased content

methods.description:
Return content purchased by the user, such as rentals and electronic sell through purchases.

The app should return the user's 100 most recent purchases in `entries`. The total count of purchases must be provided in `count`. If `count` is greater than the total number of `entries`, the UI may provide a link into the app to see the complete purchase list.

The `EntityInfo` object returned is not required to have `waysToWatch` populated, but it is recommended that it do so in case the UI wants to surface additional information on the purchases screen.

The app should implement both Push and Pull methods for `purchasedContent`.

The app should actively push `purchasedContent` when:

*  The app becomes Active.
*  When the state of the purchasedContent set has changed.
*  The app goes into Inactive or Background state, if there is a chance a change event has been missed.

LocalizedString.title: LocalizedString
LocalizedString.description: Localized string supports either a simple `string` or a Map<string, string> of language codes to strings. When using a simple `string`, the current preferred langauge from `Localization.langauge()` is assumed.
examples: A simple string, with no language code

enabled.description: Whether or not audio descriptions should be enabled by default

AppIntentMessage.title: AppIntentMessage
AppIntentMessage.description: A message sent to a Firebolt app.

PlatformIntentMessage.title: PlatformIntentMessage
PlatformIntentMessage.description: A message sent to the Firebolt platform.

Intent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention.

NavigationIntent.title: NavigationIntent
NavigationIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate to a specific place in an app.

DiscoveryIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to discover something at the aggregate experience level, e.g. content, apps, etc.

DeviceIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to control some aspect of their device.

PlaybackControlIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to control some aspect of in-progress playback.

DialogIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a platform or user intention to converse in a dialog.

LaunchIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to launch an app.
LaunchIntent.title: LaunchIntent

HomeIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to it's home screen, and bring that app to the foreground if needed.
HomeIntent.title: HomeIntent

EntityIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to a specific entity page, and bring that app to the foreground if needed.
EntityIntent.title: EntityIntent

ChannelIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intent to 'surf' to the next or previous channel.
ChannelIntent.title: ChannelIntent

TuneIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to 'tune' to a traditional over-the-air broadcast, or an OTT Stream from an OTT or vMVPD App.
TuneIntent.title: TuneIntent

options.description: The options property of the data property MUST have only one of the following fields.

assetId.description: The ID of a specific 'listing', as scoped by the target App's ID-space, which the App should begin playback from.

restartCurrentProgram.description: Denotes that the App should start playback at the most recent program boundary, rather than 'live.'

time.description: ISO 8601 Date/Time where the App should begin playback from.

PlaybackIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to a the video player for a specific, playable entity, and bring that app to the foreground if needed.
PlaybackIntent.title: PlaybackIntent

SearchIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to it's search UI with a search term populated, and bring that app to the foreground if needed.
SearchIntent.title: SearchIntent

SectionIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to a section not covered by `home`, `entity`, `player`, or `search`, and bring that app to the foreground if needed.
SectionIntent.title: SectionIntent

PlayEntityIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to a the video player for a specific, playable entity, and bring that app to the foreground if needed.
PlayEntityIntent.title: PlayEntityIntent

PlayQueryIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate an app to a the video player for an abstract query to be searched for and played by the app.
PlayQueryIntent.title: PlayQueryIntent

ContentDiscoveryIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to discover content with out a clear specific entity match.
ContentDiscoveryIntent.title: ContentDiscoveryIntent

EntityAppSelectionIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to navigate to a specific entity that could be served by more than one app.
EntityAppSelectionIntent.title: EntityAppSelectionIntent

FocusIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to interact with their device in a way analogous to pressing remote directional pad buttons.
FocusIntent.title: FocusIntent

SelectIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to interact with their device in a way analogous to pressing the remote 'select' button.
SelectIntent.title: SelectIntent

BackIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to interact with their device in a way analogous to pressing the remote 'back' button.
BackIntent.title: BackIntent

ExitIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to interact with their device in a way analogous to pressing the remote 'back' button.
ExitIntent.title: ExitIntent

ScrollIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to interact with their device in a way analogous to pressing remote directional pad buttons.
ScrollIntent.title: ScrollIntent

ButtonIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to interact with their device in a way analogous to pressing one of the remote buttons.
ButtonIntent.title: ButtonIntent

VolumeIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to change the device volume.
VolumeIntent.title: VolumeIntent

MuteIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to mute or unmute the device.
MuteIntent.title: MuteIntent

PowerIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to turn their device on or off.
PowerIntent.title: PowerIntent

MicrophoneIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to turn their microphone on or off.
MicrophoneIntent.title: MicrophoneIntent

InputIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to change which video input is active.
InputIntent.title: InputIntent

PauseIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to pause in-progress playback.
PauseIntent.title: PauseIntent

PlayIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to play/resume content.
PlayIntent.title: PlayIntent

ReplayIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to replay content.
ReplayIntent.title: ReplayIntent

StopIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to stop content.
StopIntent.title: StopIntent

PlaybackSpeedIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to change the speed of in-progress playback.
PlaybackSpeedIntent.title: PlaybackSpeedIntent

FastForwardIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to fast-forward in-progress playback.
FastForwardIntent.title: FastForwardIntent

RewindIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to rewind in-progress playback.
RewindIntent.title: RewindIntent

SeekIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to seek to a different time for in-progress playback.
SeekIntent.title: SeekIntent

SkipIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to skip a scene/chapter/ad during in-progress playback.

ClosedCaptionsIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to enable/disable closed captions.

VoiceGuidanceIntent.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a user intention to enable/disable voice guidance.

ProgramType.title: ProgramType
ProgramType.description: In the case of a program `entityType`, specifies the program type.

MusicType.title: MusicType
MusicType.description: In the case of a music `entityType`, specifies the type of music entity.

EntityInfo.title: EntityInfo
EntityInfo.description:
An EntityInfo object represents an "entity" on the platform. Currently, only entities of type `program` are supported. `programType` must be supplied to identify the program type.

Additionally, EntityInfo objects must specify a properly formed
ContentIdentifiers object, `entityType`, and `title`.  The app should provide
the `synopsis` property for a good user experience if the content
metadata is not available another way.

The ContentIdentifiers must be sufficient for navigating the user to the
appropriate entity or detail screen via a `detail` intent or deep link.

EntityInfo objects must provide at least one WayToWatch object when returned as
part of an `entityInfo` method and a streamable asset is available to the user.
It is optional for the `purchasedContent` method, but recommended because the UI
may use those data.

entityType.description: The type of the entity, e.g. `program` or `music`.

seasonNumber.description: For TV seasons, the season number. For TV episodes, the season that the episode belongs to.

seasonCount.description: For TV series, seasons, and episodes, the total number of seasons.

episodeNumber.description: For TV episodes, the episode number.

episodeCount.description: For TV seasons and episodes, the total number of episodes in the current season.

releaseDate.description: The date that the program or entity was released or first aired.

contentRatings.description: A list of ContentRating objects, describing the entity's ratings in various rating schemes.

waysToWatch.description: An array of ways a user is might watch this entity, regardless of entitlements.

OfferingType.title: OfferingType
OfferingType.description: The offering type of the WayToWatch.

WayToWatch.title: WayToWatch

expires.description: Time when the WayToWatch is no longer available.

entitled.description: Specify if the user is entitled to watch the entity.

entitledExpires.description: Time when the entity is no longer entitled.

hasAds.description: True if the streamable asset contains ads.

price.description: For "buy" and "rent" WayToWatch, the price to buy or rent in the user's preferred currency.

videoQuality.description: List of the video qualities available via the WayToWatch.

audioProfile.description: List of the audio types available via the WayToWatch.

audioLanguages.description: List of audio track languages available on the WayToWatch. The first is considered the primary language. Languages are expressed as ISO 639 1/2 codes.

closedCaptions.description: List of languages for which closed captions are available on the WayToWatch. Languages are expressed as ISO 639 1/2 codes.

subtitles.description: List of languages for which subtitles are available on the WayToWatch. Languages are expressed as ISO 639 1/2 codes.

audioDescriptions.description: List of languages for which audio descriptions (DVD) as available on the WayToWatch. Languages are expressed as ISO 639 1/2 codes.

WayToWatch.description:
A WayToWatch describes a way to watch a video program. It may describe a single
streamable asset or a set of streamable assets. For example, an app provider may
describe HD, SD, and UHD assets as individual WayToWatch objects or rolled into
a single WayToWatch.

If the WayToWatch represents a single streamable asset, the provided
ContentIdentifiers must be sufficient to play back the specific asset when sent
via a playback intent or deep link. If the WayToWatch represents multiple
streamable assets, the provided ContentIdentifiers must be sufficient to
playback one of the assets represented with no user action. In this scenario,
the app SHOULD choose the best asset for the user based on their device and
settings. The ContentIdentifiers MUST also be sufficient for navigating the user
to the appropriate entity or detail screen via an entity intent.

The app should set the `entitled` property to indicate if the user can watch, or
not watch, the asset without making a purchase. If the entitlement is known to
expire at a certain time (e.g., a rental), the app should also provide the
`entitledExpires` property. If the entitlement is not expired, the UI will use
the `entitled` property to display watchable assets to the user, adjust how
assets are presented to the user, and how intents into the app are generated.
For example, the the Aggregated Experience could render a "Watch" button for an
entitled asset versus a "Subscribe" button for an non-entitled asset.

The app should set the `offeringType` to define how the content may be
authorized. The UI will use this to adjust how content is presented to the user.

A single WayToWatch cannot represent streamable assets available via multiple
purchase paths. If, for example, an asset has both Buy, Rent and Subscription
availability, the three different entitlement paths MUST be represented as
multiple WayToWatch objects.

`price` should be populated for WayToWatch objects with `buy` or `rent`
`offeringType`. If the WayToWatch represents a set of assets with various price
points, the `price` provided must be the lowest available price.

ContentRating.title: ContentRating

advisories.description: Optional list of subratings or content advisories.

ContentRating.description:
A ContentRating represents an age or content based of an entity. Supported rating schemes and associated types are below.

## United States

`US-Movie` (MPAA):

Ratings: `NR`, `G`, `PG`, `PG13`, `R`, `NC17`

Advisories: `AT`, `BN`, `SL`, `SS`, `N`, `V`

`US-TV` (Vchip):

Ratings: `TVY`, `TVY7`, `TVG`, `TVPG`, `TV14`, `TVMA`

Advisories: `FV`, `D`, `L`, `S`, `V`

## Canada

`CA-Movie` (OFRB):

Ratings: `G`, `PG`, `14A`, `18A`, `R`, `E`

`CA-TV` (AGVOT)

Ratings: `E`, `C`, `C8`, `G`, `PG`, `14+`, `18+`

Advisories: `C`, `C8`, `G`, `PG`, `14+`, `18+`

`CA-Movie-Fr` (Canadian French language movies):

Ratings: `G`, `8+`, `13+`, `16+`, `18+`

`CA-TV-Fr` (Canadian French language TV):

Ratings: `G`, `8+`, `13+`, `16+`, `18+`

ContentIdentifiers.title: ContentIdentifiers

assetId.description: Identifies a particular playable asset. For example, the HD version of a particular movie separate from the UHD version.

entityId.description: Identifies an entity, such as a Movie, TV Series or TV Episode.

seasonId.description: The TV Season for a TV Episode.

seriesId.description: The TV Series for a TV Episode or TV Season.

ContentIdentifiers.description:
The ContentIdentifiers object is how the app identifies an entity or asset to
the Firebolt platform. These ids are used to look up metadata and deep link into
the app.

Apps do not need to provide all ids. They only need to provide the minimum
required to target a playable stream or an entity detail screen via a deep link.
If an id isn't needed to get to those pages, it doesn't need to be included.

waysToWatch.description: An array of ways a user is might watch this entity, regardless of entitlements.

entityId.description: ID of the channel, in the target App's scope.

MovieEntity.title: MovieEntity
MovieEntity.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a Movie entity.

TVEpisodeEntity.title: TVEpisodeEntity
TVEpisodeEntity.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a TV Episode entity.

TVSeasonEntity.title: TVSeasonEntity
TVSeasonEntity.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a TV Season entity.

TVSeriesEntity.title: TVSeriesEntity
TVSeriesEntity.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a TV Series entity.

PlaylistEntity.title: PlaylistEntity
PlaylistEntity.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of a Playlist entity.

AdditionalEntity.title: AdditionalEntity
AdditionalEntity.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of the remaining program entity types.

allOf.description: A Firebolt compliant representation of the remaining entity types.

seasonNumber.description: For TV seasons, the season number. For TV episodes, the season that the episode belongs to.

seasonCount.description: For TV series, seasons, and episodes, the total number of seasons.

episodeNumber.description: For TV episodes, the episode number.

episodeCount.description: For TV seasons and episodes, the total number of episodes in the current season.

releaseDate.description: The date that the program or entity was released or first aired.

contentRatings.description: A list of ContentRating objects, describing the entity's ratings in various rating schemes.

Advertising.AdPolicy.title: AdPolicy
Advertising.AdPolicy.description: Describes various ad playback enforcement rules that the app should follow.

coppa.description: Whether or not the app requires US COPPA compliance.

environment.description: Whether the app is running in a production or test mode.

authenticationEntity.description: The authentication provider, when it is separate entity than the app provider, e.g. an MVPD.

scope.description: Provides the options to send scope type and id to select desired advertising id

type.description: The scope type, which will determine where to show advertisement

id.description: A value that identifies a specific scope within the scope type

SkipRestriction.title: SkipRestriction
SkipRestriction.description:
The advertisement skip restriction.

Applies to fast-forward/rewind (e.g. trick mode), seeking over an entire opportunity (e.g. jump), seeking out of what's currently playing, and "Skip this ad..." features. Seeking over multiple ad opportunities only requires playback of the _last_ opportunity, not all opportunities, preceding the seek destination.

| Value        | Description                                                                    |
|--------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| none         |No fast-forward, jump, or skip restrictions                                    |
| adsUnwatched | Restrict fast-forward, jump, and skip for unwatched ad opportunities only.     |
| adsAll       | Restrict fast-forward, jump, and skip for all ad opportunities                 |
| all          | Restrict fast-forward, jump, and skip for all ad opportunities and all content |

Namespace: `xrn:advertising:policy:skipRestriction:`

CreateParameters.title: CreateParameters
CreateParameters.description: A an object describing the initialization parameters passed to an app during the create method.

role.description: Which role of the capability to check the state of, default will be 'use'

items.description: Describes when this grant policy should be evaluated. 'invocation' causes this policy to be evaluated when a firebolt method is invoked and that method requires the capability this policy is for. 'activeSession' is when an application's firebolt state transitions to an active state (foreground/background) from an inactive state and this application is permitted to this capability. This field on the policy is an array, which means this policy could be evaluated at multiple places. For instance the policy could be evaluated at both invocation time and activeSession time. The default value for this field is ['invocation'], meaning the policy is only evaluated when a method is invoked.

persistence.description: Tells Firebolt how to persist the grant state for this policy. If this is set to account, then any device that shares the same account id will have their user grant synced. If a user makes a grant decision on one device, that grant decision will be used by another device on the same account. The time of expiration for the grant is shared across devices as well. Only lifespan of 'forever' and 'seconds' are supported for account persistence. The means of syncing the user grants across devices is left up to the Firebolt implementation. The default value for persistence is 'device', this just means the grants are stored locally on the current device and are not shared to any other devices.

property.description: The Firebolt <Module>.<getter> RPC method name for a property

autoApplyPolicy.description: Policy which describes how to to silently apply the grant. 'always' - Silently grant if value matches allow-value and silently deny if value does not match allow value. 'allowed' - Silently grant if value matches allow-value. 'disallowed' - Silently deny if value does not match allow-value. 'never' - Do not silently grant for any case

updateProperty.description: Whether to update the property value to match the grant.

Capability.title: Capability
Capability.description: A Capability is a discrete unit of functionality that a Firebolt device might be able to perform.

Role.title: Role
Role.description: Role provides access level for the app for a given capability.

Permission.title: Permission
Permission.description: A capability combined with a Role, which an app may be permitted (by a distributor) or granted (by an end user).

DenyReason.title: DenyReason
DenyReason.description: Reasons why a Capability might not be invokable

permitted.description: Provides info whether the capability is permitted

oneOf.description: Provides info whether the capability is granted

supported.description: Provides info whether the capability is supported

available.description: Provides info whether the capability is available

EntityInfoResult.title: EntityInfoResult
EntityInfoResult.description: The result for an `entityInfo()` push or pull.

Device.NetworkType.title: NetworkType
Device.NetworkType.description: The type of network that is currently active

Device.NetworkState.title: NetworkState
Device.NetworkState.description: The type of network that is currently active

enableRecommendations.description: Whether or not to the user has enabled history-based recommendations

shareWatchHistory.description: Whether or not the user has enabled app watch history data to be shared with the platform

rememberWatchedPrograms.description: Whether or not the user has enabled watch history

Discovery.EntityInfoResult.title: EntityInfoResult
Discovery.EntityInfoResult.description: The result for an `entityInfo()` push or pull.

availabilities.description: A list of identifiers that represent what content is discoverable for the subscriber. Excluding availabilities will cause no change to the availabilities that are stored for this subscriber. Providing an empty array will clear the subscriber's availabilities

entitlements.description: A list of identifiers that represent what content is consumable for the subscriber. Excluding entitlements will cause no change to the entitlements that are stored for this subscriber. Providing an empty array will clear the subscriber's entitlements

Discovery.TuneChannels.title: TuneChannels
Discovery.TuneChannels.description: An enumeration of xrn values for the TuneIntent that have special meaning.

Keyboard.KeyboardType.title: KeyboardType
Keyboard.KeyboardType.description: The type of keyboard to show to the user

correlationId.description: An id to correlate the provider response with this request

parameters.description: The request to start a keyboard session

text.description: The text the user entered into the keyboard

canceled.description: Whether the user canceled entering text before they were finished typing on the keyboard

Lifecycle.LifecycleEvent.title: LifecycleEvent
Lifecycle.LifecycleEvent.description: A an object describing the previous and current states

source.description: The source of the lifecycle change.

Metrics.MediaPosition.title: MediaPosition
Metrics.MediaPosition.description: Represents a position inside playback content, as a decimal percentage (0-0.999) for content with a known duration, or an integer number of seconds (0-86400) for content with an unknown duration.

lmt.description: The IAB limit ad tracking opt out value.

SecondScreenEvent.title: SecondScreenEvent
SecondScreenEvent.description: An a message notification from a second screen device

id.description: The id of the app that requested the challenge

name.description: The name of the app that requested the challenge

parameters.description: The request to challenge the user

PinChallenge.ResultReason.title: ResultReason
PinChallenge.ResultReason.description: The reason for the result of challenging the user

oneOf.description: Whether the user succeeded in the pin challenge

ttl.description: Seconds from set time before the data expires and is removed

UserGrants.GrantInfo.description: Information about a grant given by a user

UserGrants.AppInfo.description: Information about an app that a grant was for

UserGrants.GrantState.description: The state the grant is in

force.description: Whether to force for user grant even if the previous decision stored

Wifi.AccessPointList.title: AccessPointList
Wifi.AccessPointList.description: List of scanned Wifi networks available near the device.

Wifi.WifiSignalStrength.title: WifiSignalStrength
Wifi.WifiSignalStrength.description: Strength of Wifi signal, value is negative based on RSSI specification.

Wifi.WifiFrequency.title: WifiFrequency
Wifi.WifiFrequency.description: Wifi Frequency in Ghz, example 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz.

Wifi.AccessPoint.title: AccessPoint
Wifi.AccessPoint.description: Properties of a scanned wifi list item.

Wifi.WPSSecurityPin.title: WPSSecurityPin
Wifi.WPSSecurityPin.description: Security pin type for WPS(Wifi Protected Setup).

Wifi.WifiConnectRequest.title: WifiConnectRequest
Wifi.WifiConnectRequest.description: Request object for the wifi connection.
